subject: Ethics
title: Codes of Ethics That Actually Work
description: A quick win: understand Codes of Ethics That Actually Work.

hook.text: 90% of Fortune 500 companies have ethics codes. Less than half of employees can name a single rule in them.

buildup.text: A code of ethics outlines principles and expected behavior. Most gather dust in HR filing cabinets.

discovery.text: Effective codes are short, specific, and backed by leadership who visibly follow them. Example matters more than text.

twist.text: Johnson & Johnson's credo guided their 1982 Tylenol recallâ€”pulling $100M in product to protect consumers.

climax.text: The difference: J&J's leaders used their code in a crisis. Most companies frame theirs and forget it.

punchline.text: A code works when the CEO follows it on the worst day.

quiz.question: What makes a corporate code of ethics effective?
options: Making it as long and detailed as possible
Leadership visibly following it, especially during crises
Keeping it secret from most employees
